meanings.definition: A person who works on a railroad maintaining tracks.
meanings.sent1: The trackman repaired the broken rails efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The trackman walked along the tracks checking for any damage.
meanings.sent3: The trackman joked that he could fix the tracks blindfolded.
meanings.sent4: The trackman's dedication to his job was as solid as the steel rails.
meanings.sent5: Children waved excitedly at the trackman as he passed by in his work cart.

meanings.definition: A device used to track the movement of a vehicle or person.
meanings.sent1: The trackman attached the GPS tracker to the car.
meanings.sent2: The trackman monitored the delivery truck's location in real-time.
meanings.sent3: The trackman accidentally dropped the tracking device in the mud.
meanings.sent4: The trackman's device was as reliable as a compass in the wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The trackman's gadget beeped loudly whenever the car changed direction.

meanings.definition: A software program used to track data and statistics in sports.
meanings.sent1: The trackman analyzed the baseball player's performance using the software.
meanings.sent2: The trackman inputted the race results into the tracking program.
meanings.sent3: The trackman's computer screen was filled with colorful graphs and numbers.
meanings.sent4: The trackman's software was as precise as a stopwatch in a race.
meanings.sent5: The trackman's program could track every move of the players on the field.
